column4: Hi everyone. Hopefully someone can help me out ! I just used partition magic on my XP to shrink it to be able to install ubuntu. But as lucky as I am, it gave an error at 52 % and now XP won't boot (even in safe mode) Is there any way to check for bad sectors on NTFS while in ubuntu live ? Or any other suggestions to fix this problem ? Thanks alot ! Feel free to pm me btw.
we don't deal in problems caused by windows programs for windows partitions. ask microsoft or something
get out your windows CD instead. and it'snot ubuntu problem. ubuntu cannot chkdsk NTFS disks
